alert.note: Alert for Butte County Area (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 31 at 2:38PM MDT until August 01 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT MONDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 322, 327, AND 329... .Hot temperatures, very dry air, and gusty northwest winds are expected Monday afternoon and early evening over parts of the northeast Wyoming plains as well as parts of the far western South Dakota plains. Minimum relative humidities will drop to 10-15%. A surface trough slips into the area Monday afternoon with northwest winds at 10-20 MPH with gusts from 25-35 MPH behind it. The combination will create critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT MONDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 316, AND 327... The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 9 PM MDT Monday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 314 Northern Campbell, 316 Crook County Plains and 327 Butte County Area. * WINDS...Northwest 10 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
